sub_title: Civil/Environmental Engineer with electrical utility experience and strong preferences in Project Coordination.
summary:
I am a wife, mother, engineer, expatriate, planner and problem-solver.
I am originally from South Africa and moved to the Netherlands in February 2020.  I took some time off to settle with my family in a new country, learn a new language and completed a short course in Project Management.
I am passionate about the environment and enjoy participating in optimising engineering solutions in order to reduce and change the external impact for the better.  I have 9+ years of experience in the electrical power transmission utility environment and I enjoy working in a team alongside diverse professionals from different backgrounds and skill sets. 
I completed my Bachelor’s degree in Civil Engineering in December 2010 and started my career at Eskom Holdings Ltd in 2011.  As a design engineer, I was responsible for feasibility, concept and detail design of various large substation projects up to 765 kV.  Due to my interest in the “bigger picture” and large complex problems, I continued my further studies in Environmental Engineering at the University of Pretoria (BEng Hons, 2013).  In 2014, whilst continuing in my work as a project engineer I was fortunate to be successfully  selected to participate in the Eskom Power Plant Engineering Initiative as researcher and engineer.  This program allowed me to further develop my skills in solving large problems and provided ample opportunities to work with various persons outside of the design environment.  As part of this program, I completed my Masters degree in Chemical Engineering and applied my research to strategic environmental projects within the organization.
I am a dedicated, disciplined and hardworking individual that flourishes in a dynamic environment.  I take pride in my work and I am determined to achieve goals, set by myself and my superiors.  I have a logical, rational and critical thinking approach and I am comfortable with analytical problem solving.  I have a high preference for organisation and procedural approaches and also attention to detail.  I can strongly focus on the task at hand by being precise and accurate in my approach.  I have a high regard for security and safekeeping and thus find comfort in planning to be prepared for all events.  I am educated and well-read which places me in the advantageous position to communicate effectively. 
In my free time I like to read, travel the world, do event planning and coordination and most importantly spend quality time with my family and friends.

profile_positions.description:
I was a core technical advisor for the new FGD gypsum strategy for Eskom with my advise stemming from the work performed in my Masters. I was also a technical team member in a diverse team to provide research and strategies for the fly ash drive and utilisation in the engineering market. One of the key projects was an application lodged to the Department of Environmental Affairs to amend legislation to enable the use of coal combustion products safely in more sectors. I had the opportunity to liaise with  internal and external stakeholders and also to work in an exciting and developing industry within a great team.

I continued working as a Design Engineer in the High Voltage environment and was involved in larger scale greenfields and brownfields projects. I continued with my involvement in research projects and made contributions within Cigre Working Groups.
profile_positions.title: Technical Advisor / Engineer

profile_positions.description:
I took on the opportunity to perform research in the environmental and chemical engineering fields under the Eskom Power Plant Engineering Initiative program. This program enable employees to take part in large strategic problem solving through formal research projects. With my research I aimed to investigate the feasibility of utilising coal combustion products in the engineering industry. I collaborated with International institutions and visited EDF Polska in Rybnik, Poland for one month to oversee their best practices. 

My research was published in a Masters thesis in Chemical Engineering from the North West University South Africa with the title: "Value added utilisation possibilities of coal combustion products in South Africa."
profile_positions.title: Corporate Researcher

profile_positions.description:
My role as a Civil Design Engineer within the High Voltage Substations environment within Eskom Transmission included some of the following activities:
• Flood & surface water drainage design and site selection.
• Road design & authority applications for approval.
• Technical Tender Evaluation & Contracting.
• Writing of Standards & Specifications.
• Project Lead Civil Designer & Report Writing.
I was responsible for all the different life cycle phases of projects, from concept, through detail, execution as well as construction support.
profile_positions.title: Civil Design Engineer
